meanings.sent1: The mountain had the jaggiest rocks I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The broken glass was the jaggiest I had ever encountered.
meanings.sent3: The jaggiest edges on the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put together.
meanings.sent4: The jagged cliffs looked even jaggiest under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The jaggiest thorns on the rose bush made it difficult to prune.

meanings.sent1: That was the jaggiest piece of metal I've ever touched.
meanings.sent2: The jaggiest part of the fence was where it had been bent.
meanings.sent3: The jaggiest edges on the paper made it difficult to tear neatly.
meanings.sent4: The jaggiest rocks on the beach were perfect for climbing.
meanings.sent5: The jaggiest branches on the tree scratched my arm as I passed by.

meanings.sent1: The jaggiest terrain was challenging for the hikers to navigate.
meanings.sent2: The jaggiest outline of the mountain stood out against the sky.
meanings.sent3: The jaggiest edges of the map indicated dangerous cliffs.
meanings.sent4: The jaggiest pieces of the broken vase were difficult to glue back together.
meanings.sent5: The jaggiest edges of the torn fabric caught on everything it touched.
